intro: Thlaspi eigii subsp. samuelssonii, commonly known as the Samuelson's rockcress, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing, perennial herb that typically reaches a height of 5–15 cm. The plant features basal leaves that are lanceolate to elliptic in shape, with a waxy coating. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, which are characteristic of the mustard family. This subspecies is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, thriving in alpine or arctic environments.
